meanings.definition: A person or thing that ignites or starts a fire.
meanings.sent1: The igniters in the forest were the dry leaves and twigs.
meanings.sent2: The firefighter used igniters to light the campfire.
meanings.sent3: The igniters, like mischievous little elves, danced around the bonfire.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the igniters that sparked a warmth in his heart.
meanings.sent5: The igniters of the revolution were the passionate speeches of the leader.

meanings.definition: A device used to ignite fuel in an engine.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic checked the igniters in the car engine.
meanings.sent2: The spark plug is an essential igniters in a gasoline engine.
meanings.sent3: The igniters in the engine played a symphony of combustion.
meanings.sent4: His words acted as the igniters that fired up her determination.
meanings.sent5: The igniters in the rocket engine propelled the spacecraft into space.

meanings.definition: A person who stirs up or provokes a conflict or argument.
meanings.sent1: She was known as the igniters of drama in the office.
meanings.sent2: The politician was accused of being an igniters of unrest in the country.
meanings.sent3: The igniters of chaos seemed to follow him wherever he went.
meanings.sent4: His reckless behavior acted as the igniters of tension among the group.
meanings.sent5: The igniters of the debate were the controversial statements made by the guest speaker.
